required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Look at How Effective Briviact is as add-on Treatment for Patients With Epilepsy With Partial Onset Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-Month Noninterventional, Postmarketing, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness of Briviact® (Brivaracetam) as Adjunctive Therapy in Patients With Epilepsy With Partial-onset Seizures in Daily Clinical Practice

brief_summary.textblock: Study is the first study after commercialization of brivaracetam. It is designed to collect real world information on the effectiveness of brivaracetam in patients with Partial Onset Seizure epislepsy who are treated in standard clinical practice.

detailed_description.textblock:
EP0077 is a 12 months, multicenter, noninterventional study (NIS) conducted at specialized sites in approximately 10 European countries. Patients will be treated according to usual medical diagnostic procedures and therapy; commercially available brivaracetam will be prescribed according to normal clinical practice and the current Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) in Europe for brivaracetam (BRV). The prescription of BRV is clearly separated from the decision to include the patient in the study. No additional diagnostic or monitoring procedures are applied to the patients.
The primary objective of this study is to determine BRV retention over a 12 month period as a measure of effectiveness in a real world setting. The secondary objective of this study is to assess seizure control with BRV treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Remaining in the Study and on BRV Treatment at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: Participants who remained in the study and were on BRV treatment for at least 1 year (>=330 days) after their start of BRV were classed as having 12 months of treatment retention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Remaining in the Study and on BRV Treatment at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who remained in the study and were on BRV treatment for at least 3 months (>=90 days) after first BRV administration were classed as having 3 months of treatment retention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Remaining in the Study and on BRV Treatment at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who remained in the study and were on BRV treatment for at least 6 months (>=180 days) after first BRV administration were classed as having 6 months of treatment retention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in POS frequency was defined as: 28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in POS frequency was defined as: 28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in POS frequency was defined as: 28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to End of Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 1) to end of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in POS frequency was defined as: 28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change in POS frequency was defined as: ((28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency)/28-day Baseline) x 100. A positive value indicates a reduction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change in POS frequency was defined as: ((28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency)/28-day Baseline) x 100. A positive value indicates a reduction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change in POS frequency was defined as: ((28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency)/28-day Baseline) x 100. A positive value indicates a reduction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency From Baseline to End of Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 1) to end of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent change in POS frequency was defined as: ((28-day Baseline - 28-day post-Baseline seizure frequency)/28-day Baseline) x 100. A positive value indicates a reduction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a (greater than or equal to [>=] 50%) reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >=50% reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >=50% reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >=50% reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >=50% reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >=50% reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at End of Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) to end of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >=50% reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responders Based on Percent Reduction (>=50%) in Partial-onset Seizure (POS) Frequency at End of Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) to end of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >=50% reduction from Baseline in seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=no) at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date or participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date (Visit 2 [Month 3] = Day 90) were counted as No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=no) at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date or participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date (Visit 2 [Month 3] = Day 90) were counted as No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=Missing) at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date were counted as a No. Participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date without any seizures recorded up to discontinuation or termination were excluded from the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=Missing) at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date were counted as a No. Participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date without any seizures recorded up to discontinuation or termination were excluded from the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=no) at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date or participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date (Visit 3 [Month 6] = Day 180) were counted as No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=no) at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date or participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date (Visit 3 [Month 6] = Day 180) were counted as No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=Missing) at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date were counted as a No. Participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date without any seizures recorded up to discontinuation or termination were excluded from the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=Missing) at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date were counted as a No. Participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date without any seizures recorded up to discontinuation or termination were excluded from the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=no) at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date or participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date (Visit 4 [Month 12] = Day 330) were counted as No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=no) at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date or participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date (Visit 4 [Month 12] = Day 330) were counted as No.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=Missing) at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date were counted as a No. Participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date without any seizures recorded up to discontinuation or termination were excluded from the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=Missing) at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date were counted as a No. Participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date without any seizures recorded up to discontinuation or termination were excluded from the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Seizure After First Dose of Brivaracetam
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first seizure was calculated as: Date of first seizure - date of first BRV administration + 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure Free Participants at End of Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. End of Observation Period (up to Month 12), includes participants who are completers or withdrew early.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Seizure Free Participants at End of Observation Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
secondary_outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. End of Observation Period (up to Month 12), includes participants who are completers or withdrew early.

clinical_study.condition: Epilepsy With POS With or Without Secondary Generalization

study_pop.textblock:
Patients (male or female ≥16 years of age) with a clinical diagnosis of epilepsy with Partial Onset Seizures with or without secondary generalization. The patients have never been treated with brivaracetam and the decision by the treating physician (neurologists) to prescribe brivaracetam is made independently of the participation in the study and prior to enrollment.
Patient meets the criteria for treatment with brivaracetam as adjunctive therapy according to the current SmPC in Europe. Patient is using a seizure diary as part of their standard of care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has never been treated with brivaracetam (BRV) prior to enrollment in this Non-Interventional Study (NIS)
- The decision by the treating physician to prescribe BRV is made independently of the participation in the NIS
- Patient is a male or female ≥16 years of age
- Patient has a clinical diagnosis of epilepsy with partial-onset seizures POS with or without secondary generalization
- Patient uses an epilepsy/seizure diary.
Exclusion Criteria:
No specific exclusion criteria

patient_data.ipd_description: Data from non-interventional studies is outside of UCB's data sharing policy and is unavailable for sharing.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study started to enroll participants in February 2016 and concluded in July 2020.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow refers to the Safety Set.

group.title: Brivaracetam (BRV)
group.description: Participants were treated with commercially available BRV as prescribed by treating physicians, in accordance with current clinical practice and in accordance with the approved European Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Participant moved to another country and continued treatment for epilepsy in that country
Progression of other medical condition (dementia, pneumonia)
Perceived increase in seizures but diary records show no increase compared to pre-study
Participant experience side effects, fatigue. Most likely not related to investigational product
Stopped in preparation for epilepsy surgery
Diagnosis epilepsy revised to psychogenic seizures
Participant was not able to come in our clinic because participant could not find a car driver

baseline.population: Baseline Characteristics refer to the Safety Set which consisted of all participants which were included in the All Subjects Documented Set for whom it could not be excluded that they received treatment with BRV at least once in the study.

group.description: Participants were treated with commercially available BRV as prescribed by treating physicians, in accordance with current clinical practice and in accordance with the approved European Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC).

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.description: Participants who remained in the study and were on BRV treatment for at least 1 year (>=330 days) after their start of BRV were classed as having 12 months of treatment retention.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) was defined as all participants in the Safety Set (SS) who did not receive BRV before entering this non interventional study (NIS).

outcome.title: Number of Seizure Free Participants (When Discontinuations Were Counted as Seizure Freedom=no) at Month 3
outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. Participants with seizures before the visit date or participants who discontinued BRV or terminated the study prior to the target visit date (Visit 2 [Month 3] = Day 90) were counted as No.
outcome.population: FAS was defined as all participants in the Safety Set (SS) who did not receive BRV before entering this NIS. Here number of participants were included who were evaluable for the assessment

outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. outcome.title: Time to First Seizure After First Dose of Brivaracetam
outcome.description: Time to first seizure was calculated as: Date of first seizure - date of first BRV administration + 1.
outcome.population: FAS was defined as all participants in the Safety Set (SS) who did not receive BRV before entering this NIS.

group.title: Brivaracetam (FAS)
group.description: Participants were treated with commercially available BRV as prescribed by treating physicians, in accordance with current clinical practice and in accordance with the approved European Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC). Participants formed the Full Analysis Set (FAS).

measure.population: FAS was defined as all participants in the Safety Set (SS) who did not receive BRV before entering this NIS.

outcome.title: Number of Seizure Free Participants at End of Observation Period
outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. End of Observation Period (up to Month 12), includes participants who are completers or withdrew early.
outcome.time_frame: End of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
outcome.population: FAS was defined as all participants in the Safety Set (SS) who did not receive BRV before entering this NIS.

group.title: Brivaracetam (FAS)
group.description: Participants were treated with commercially available BRV as prescribed by treating physicians, in accordance with current clinical practice and in accordance with the approved European Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC). Participants formed the Full Analysis Set (FAS).

measure.title: Number of Seizure Free Participants at End of Observation Period
measure.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. End of Observation Period (up to Month 12), includes participants who are completers or withdrew early.
measure.population: FAS was defined as all participants in the Safety Set (SS) who did not receive BRV before entering this NIS.

measurement_list.measurement: There was no opportunity for the participant to withdraw from the study at the 12-month time point, as they were classified as completers at that stage. Therefore, by definition End of Observation Period (up to Month 12, which includes participants as withdrawn or completers) was identical to Month 12 (including completers alone) results. Hence, the analysis were not performed for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Percent of Seizure Free Participants at End of Observation Period
outcome.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. End of Observation Period (up to Month 12), includes participants who are completers or withdrew early.
outcome.time_frame: End of Observation Period (up to Month 12/withdrawal)
outcome.population: FAS was defined as all participants in the Safety Set (SS) who did not receive BRV before entering this NIS.

group.title: Brivaracetam (FAS)
group.description: Participants were treated with commercially available BRV as prescribed by treating physicians, in accordance with current clinical practice and in accordance with the approved European Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC). Participants formed the Full Analysis Set (FAS).

measure.title: Percent of Seizure Free Participants at End of Observation Period
measure.description: Seizure freedom (Yes) was defined as having no seizures recorded in the study on or before the visit date, having not discontinued prior to the visit and having available seizure data at the visit. measurement_list.measurement: There was no opportunity for the participant to withdraw from the study at the 12-month time point, as they were classified as completers at that stage. Therefore, by definition End of Observation Period (up to Month 12, which includes participants as withdrawn or completers) was identical to Month 12 (including completers alone) results. Hence, the analysis were not performed for this outcome measure.

reported_events.desc: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were defined as an adverse event (AE) occurring on or after the date of first BRV administration.

group.title: Brivaracetam (SS)
group.description: Participants were treated with commercially available BRV as prescribed by treating physicians, in accordance with current clinical practice and in accordance with the approved European Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC). Participants formed the Safety Set (SS).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
